page.title: 16OVER WYRESDALE:WEATHER
page.content: Being a farming area the working life here is very much affected by the weather. The rainfall here is heavy, drought rarely being a problem, but the summer of 1985 has been extremely wet. Hay crops have been poor and in some cases very difficult to get in at all. The same can be said of silage, as it is very damaging to take heavy machinery on to the sodden ground. Cattle have had to be taken inside earlier than usual. Snow is not a major problem every winter, but while great efforts are always made by the local authorities as well as farmers to clear the roads used by the milk tankers, lanes to farms some distance from the roads may be blocked or only negotiable by tractor for several days. If it looks like snow school children may be kept at home in case they may not be able to get back.
